results.byline: By Robert Chiarito and Julia Jacobs
results.title: R. Kelly Sentenced to 20 Years for Child Sex Crimes
results.abstract: The singer will serve most of the sentence in federal prison at the same time as a 30-year term for racketeering and sex trafficking.

media.caption: R. Kelly in 2019. He was convicted last year of coercing minors into sexual activity and producing sex tapes involving a minor.

results.title: Snowstorm Knocks Out Power for More Than 900,000 Customers
results.abstract: The power outages swept the Upper Midwest and New York State, and most were reported in Michigan, where a firefighter was killed.

media.caption: Driving through the snow in Minneapolis, as a prolonged winter storm continued on Thursday. Even in areas used to winter storms, travel conditions could be treacherous.

results.title: A Ruling That Could End the Internet as We Know It

results.title: The Coldest Case in Laramie

results.byline: By Mark Walker and Emily Cochrane
results.title: Crew Alerted to Problem Just Before Ohio Derailment, Investigators Say
results.abstract: The crew tried to slow down after an overheated wheel bearing set off an alarm, but 38 cars still ended up leaving the tracks, the National Transportation Safety Board said.

media.caption: The timing of when the crew was alerted to an overheated wheel bearing is a key issue in the investigation into the derailment in East Palestine, Ohio, this month.

results.title: Bronx Grandmother Charged With Stabbing 7-Year-Old Granddaughter
results.abstract: The stabbing, which took place early Tuesday in the Morrisania neighborhood, left the girl in critical but stable condition, the police said.

results.adx_keywords: Earthquakes;Research;Earth;Australian National University;Nature Communications (Journal);Solomon Islands
results.byline: By Kenneth Chang
results.title: What’s Inside the Earth’s Core?
results.abstract: Seismic waves measuring earthquakes reveal more about the deepest layers of the planet, a new study suggests.

media.caption: Two Australian scientists argue in a new paper that within the Earth’s core, based on measurements of waves reverberating along the Earth’s diameter, is an innermost inner core, about 800 miles wide.
media.copyright: Drew Whitehouse, National Computational Infrastructure’s Vizlab, Australian National University

results.title: Superintendent Resigns After Third Grader Found His Gun in School Bathroom
results.abstract: Robby Stuteville, superintendent of the Rising Star Independent School District in Texas, left his gun in an elementary school bathroom, where it was discovered by a student.

media.caption: Robby Stuteville submitted his resignation as superintendent of the Rising Star Independent School District after he left a gun in a bathroom at the district’s elementary school on Jan. 20.

results.byline: By Richard Fausset and Danny Hakim
results.title: Trump Legal Team Assails Georgia Inquiry
results.abstract: The lawyers said public comments by the forewoman of the special grand jury that investigated election interference had “poisoned” the process. But they have yet to challenge anything in court.

media.caption: Former President Donald Trump’s lawyers said that they were weighing their options in response to the forewoman’s comments. “We’re just considering everything,” said one lawyer.

results.byline: By Daniel Victor
results.title: Tom Whitlock, Writer of ‘Top Gun’ Anthem ‘Danger Zone,’ Dies at 68
results.abstract: Mr. Whitlock’s songs, including the chart-topping “Take My Breath Away,” were central to the 1986 movie.

media.caption: Giorgio Moroder, left, and Tom Whitlock posing with their Oscars at the 59th annual Academy Awards in Los Angeles on March 30, 1987. The duo received the original song honor for “Take My Breath Away,” from the movie “Top Gun.”
